Author: simonapop
Content: tbh i tend to agree with Nick and this comment re a broader consideration when it comes to treasury https://discuss.ens.domains/t/ens-dao-treasury-management-fixed-rates-using-element-finance/9662/19?u=simona_pop

Author: simonapop
Content: I do feel a better and more transparent look at and management of the treasury needs to be in place before making the decision here - and I see it in the comments as well

Author: blockchainjames
Content: Roger that, lets jam treasury management structure & considerations on tomorrows meta-gov stewards call

Author: matoken.eth
Content: I also would like to see what else available in the market and have informed decision rather than making  a binary decision about using a product A just because the project itself proposed to use their project.

Author: matoken.eth
Content: A bit similar topic, I also got enquiry about ENS DAO treasury to put liquidity into a DEX in a l2 market. If we let liquity proposal to go in without considering other options I fear it will encourage many adhoc projects to take advantage of the ENS DAO treasury. We can't stop these projects to make proposals but would like to have a step back discussion first then consider their proposal as one of the options

Author: itsdanwu
Content:
If anyone is interested in providing feedback, I've made a PR to update the Governance Docs with Q1/Q2 steward info, working group and steward rules (elections, etc): https://discuss.ens.domains/t/documenting-dao-structure-and-processes/10723/2

Links enclosed within the forum post. Follow Nick's link to get access to the Gitbook. 

This is just a first iteration, I think there's more room for improvement that we can tack on afterwards! 

Happy to jump on a call to discuss if anyone has questions.
